title: Kirsten Dunst Sells Longtime Lakefront Home in Los Angeles
text:
Actress Kirsten Dunst has sold her longtime Los Angeles home for $4.55 million, according to listing records.



Ms. Dunst—who is currently starring in the new Showtime series “On Becoming a God in Central Florida”—had owned the lakefront home in the tony Toluca Lake neighborhood for 18 years.



More: High-Tech San Francisco Home Lists for $29.8 Million

She bought it in 2001 for $2.6 million using a trust linked to her production company, property records show.



The Cape Cod-style house enclosed by a white picket fence, spans 4,333 square feet. It has five bedrooms and “offers a spectacular yet comfortable and cozy feel throughout,” according to the listing with Harvey Good Bitler Jr. of Keller Williams, who did not immediately respond to a request for comment.



There is also a chef’s kitchen with custom cabinetry and marble counters, a master suite with high ceilings, his-and-hers walk-in closets and a balcony with mountain views, and French doors galore leading outside.



The outdoor space is split over three levels and includes a patio, a custom-built gazebo, an outdoor kitchen, firepits, a pool and spa, plus a deck and a private dock on the lake, the listing said.



The house found a buyer quickly, going into contact just nine days after it hit the market for $4.7 million in June, and it closed earlier this month.



From Penta: Banksy’s ‘Devolved Parliament’ Heading to Auction Prior to Brexit Day

Though Mansion Global could not determine who bought the home, the new owner is reportedly “Ghostbusters” and “Designing Women” actress Annie Potts, according to the Los Angeles Times, who first reported the sale.



A representative for Ms. Potts, 66, did not immediately respond to a request for comment.



A representative for Ms. Dunst, 37, who is engaged to actor Jesse Plemons, 31, could not immediately be reached for comment.



The home is just a few doors down from another Toluca Lake home that found a buyer at lightning speed. A three-story Spanish-style estate owned by Oscar-nominated producer Dana Brunetti hit the market in July and was pending sale three days later, Mansion Global previously reported. Listing records show the transaction has yet to close.
